trans-unit.source: Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to upload and access data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight using the Azure CLI, Azure Storage Explorer, Azure PowerShell, the Hadoop command line, or Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to upload and access data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight using the Azure CLI, Azure Storage Explorer, Azure PowerShell, the Hadoop command line, or Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight provides a full-featured Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) over Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight provides a full-featured Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS) over Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: It is designed as an HDFS extension to provide a seamless experience to customers.
trans-unit.target: It is designed as an HDFS extension to provide a seamless experience to customers.

trans-unit.source: It enables the full set of components in the Hadoop ecosystem to operate directly on the data it manages.
trans-unit.target: It enables the full set of components in the Hadoop ecosystem to operate directly on the data it manages.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage and HDFS are distinct file systems that are optimized for storage of data and computations on that data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage and HDFS are distinct file systems that are optimized for storage of data and computations on that data.

trans-unit.source: For information about the benefits of using Azure Blob storage, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the benefits of using Azure Blob storage, see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Note the following requirement before you begin:
trans-unit.target: Note the following requirement before you begin:

trans-unit.source: An Azure HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Azure HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Get started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Get started with Azure HDInsight[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Why blob storage?
trans-unit.target: Why blob storage?

trans-unit.source: Azure HDInsight clusters are typically deployed to run MapReduce jobs, and the clusters are dropped after these jobs complete.
trans-unit.target: Azure HDInsight clusters are typically deployed to run MapReduce jobs, and the clusters are dropped after these jobs complete.

trans-unit.source: Keeping the data in the HDFS clusters after computations are complete would be an expensive way to store this data.
trans-unit.target: Keeping the data in the HDFS clusters after computations are complete would be an expensive way to store this data.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage is a highly available, highly scalable, high capacity, low cost, and shareable storage option for data that is to be processed using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage is a highly available, highly scalable, high capacity, low cost, and shareable storage option for data that is to be processed using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Storing data in a blob enables the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation to be safely released without losing data.
trans-unit.target: Storing data in a blob enables the HDInsight clusters that are used for computation to be safely released without losing data.

trans-unit.source: Directories
trans-unit.target: Directories

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage containers store data as key/value pairs, and there is no directory hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage containers store data as key/value pairs, and there is no directory hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: However the "/" character can be used within the key name to make it appear as if a file is stored within a directory structure.
trans-unit.target: However the "/" character can be used within the key name to make it appear as if a file is stored within a directory structure.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight sees these as if they are actual directories.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight sees these as if they are actual directories.

trans-unit.source: For example, a blob's key may be input/log1.txt.
trans-unit.target: For example, a blob's key may be input/log1.txt.

trans-unit.source: No actual "input" directory exists, but due to the presence of the "/" character in the key name, it has the appearance of a file path.
trans-unit.target: No actual "input" directory exists, but due to the presence of the "/" character in the key name, it has the appearance of a file path.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, if you use Azure Explorer tools you may notice some 0 byte files.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, if you use Azure Explorer tools you may notice some 0 byte files.

trans-unit.source: These files serve two purposes:
trans-unit.target: These files serve two purposes:

trans-unit.source: If there are empty folders, they mark of the existence of the folder.
trans-unit.target: If there are empty folders, they mark of the existence of the folder.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage is clever enough to know that if a blob called foo/bar exists, there is a folder called foo.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage is clever enough to know that if a blob called foo/bar exists, there is a folder called foo.

trans-unit.source: But the only way to signify an empty folder called foo is by having this special 0 byte file in place.
trans-unit.target: But the only way to signify an empty folder called foo is by having this special 0 byte file in place.

trans-unit.source: They hold special metadata that is needed by the Hadoop file system, notably the permissions and owners for the folders.
trans-unit.target: They hold special metadata that is needed by the Hadoop file system, notably the permissions and owners for the folders.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Hadoop command</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Hadoop command</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: While the Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, and AzCopy can all be used from outside Azure, the Hadoop command is only available on the HDInsight cluster and only allows loading data from the local file system into Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: While the Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, and AzCopy can all be used from outside Azure, the Hadoop command is only available on the HDInsight cluster and only allows loading data from the local file system into Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform tool that allows you to manage Azure services.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform tool that allows you to manage Azure services.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to upload data to Azure Blob storage:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to upload data to Azure Blob storage:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Install and configure the Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt, bash, or other shell, and use the following to authenticate to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt, bash, or other shell, and use the following to authenticate to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the user name and password for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the user name and password for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following command to list the storage accounts for your subscription:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following command to list the storage accounts for your subscription:

trans-unit.source: Select the storage account that contains the blob you want to work with, then use the following command to retrieve the key for this account:
trans-unit.target: Select the storage account that contains the blob you want to work with, then use the following command to retrieve the key for this account:

trans-unit.source: This should return Primary and Secondary keys.
trans-unit.target: This should return Primary and Secondary keys.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Primary key value because it will be used in the next steps.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Primary key value because it will be used in the next steps.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to retrieve a list of blob containers within the storage account:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to retrieve a list of blob containers within the storage account:

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to upload and download files to the blob:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to upload and download files to the blob:

trans-unit.source: To upload a file:
trans-unit.target: To upload a file:

trans-unit.source: To download a file:
trans-unit.target: To download a file:

trans-unit.source: If you will always be working with the same storage account, you can set the following environment variables instead of specifying the account and key for every command:
trans-unit.target: If you will always be working with the same storage account, you can set the following environment variables instead of specifying the account and key for every command:

trans-unit.source: * AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT: The storage account name
trans-unit.target: * AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT: The storage account name

trans-unit.source: * AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY: The storage account key
trans-unit.target: * AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY: The storage account key

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is a scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is a scripting environment that you can use to control and automate the deployment and management of your workloads in Azure.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring your workstation to run Azure PowerShell, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring your workstation to run Azure PowerShell, see <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: To upload a local file to Azure Blob storage

trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console as instructed in <link><linkText>Install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Set the values of the first five variables in the following script:
trans-unit.target: Set the values of the first five variables in the following script:

trans-unit.source: Paste the script into the Azure PowerShell console to run it to copy the file.
trans-unit.target: Paste the script into the Azure PowerShell console to run it to copy the file.

trans-unit.source: For example PowerShell scripts created to work with HDInsight, see <link><linkText>HDInsight tools</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>AzCopy
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>AzCopy

trans-unit.source: AzCopy is a command-line tool that is designed to simplify the task of transferring data into and out of an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: AzCopy is a command-line tool that is designed to simplify the task of transferring data into and out of an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can use it as a standalone tool or incorporate this tool in an existing application.
trans-unit.target: You can use it as a standalone tool or incorporate this tool in an existing application.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Download AzCopy[azure-azcopy-download]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Download AzCopy[azure-azcopy-download]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The AzCopy syntax is:
trans-unit.target: The AzCopy syntax is:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>AzCopy - Uploading/Downloading files for Azure Blobs[azure-azcopy]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>AzCopy - Uploading/Downloading files for Azure Blobs[azure-azcopy]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Hadoop command line
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Hadoop command line

trans-unit.source: The Hadoop command line is only useful for storing data into blob storage when the data is already present on the cluster head node.
trans-unit.target: The Hadoop command line is only useful for storing data into blob storage when the data is already present on the cluster head node.

trans-unit.source: In order to use the Hadoop command, you must first connect to the headnode using one of the following methods:
trans-unit.target: In order to use the Hadoop command, you must first connect to the headnode using one of the following methods:

trans-unit.source: Windows-based HDInsight: Connect using Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Windows-based HDInsight: Connect using Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Linux-based HDInsight: Connect using SSH (the SSH command or PuTTY
trans-unit.target: Linux-based HDInsight: Connect using SSH (the SSH command or PuTTY

trans-unit.source: Once connected, you can use the following syntax to upload a file to storage.
trans-unit.target: Once connected, you can use the following syntax to upload a file to storage.

trans-unit.source: For example, hadoop fs -copyFromLocal data.txt /example/data/data.txt
trans-unit.target: For example, hadoop fs -copyFromLocal data.txt /example/data/data.txt

trans-unit.source: Because the default file system for HDInsight is in Azure Blob storage, /example/data.txt is actually in Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Because the default file system for HDInsight is in Azure Blob storage, /example/data.txt is actually in Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: You can also refer to the file as:
trans-unit.target: You can also refer to the file as:

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: For a list of other Hadoop commands that work with files, see <link><linkText>http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/r2.7.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/FileSystemShell.html</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For a list of other Hadoop commands that work with files, see <link><linkText>http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/r2.7.0/hadoop-project-dist/hadoop-common/FileSystemShell.html</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Azure Storage Explorer
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Azure Storage Explorer

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Explorer is a useful tool for inspecting and altering the data in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Explorer is a useful tool for inspecting and altering the data in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: It is a free tool that can be downloaded from CodePlex: <link><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title>Azure Storage Explorer</title></link>.
trans-unit.target: It is a free tool that can be downloaded from CodePlex: <link><linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title>Azure Storage Explorer</title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before using the tool, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: Before using the tool, you must know your Azure storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about getting this information, see the "How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys" section of <link><linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account[azure-create-storage-account]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions about getting this information, see the "How to: View, copy and regenerate storage access keys" section of <link><linkText>Create, manage, or delete a storage account[azure-create-storage-account]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Run Azure Storage Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Run Azure Storage Explorer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.AzureStorageExplorer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.AzureStorageExplorer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Account.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Account.

trans-unit.source: After an account is added to Azure Storage Explorer, you don't need to go through this step again.
trans-unit.target: After an account is added to Azure Storage Explorer, you don't need to go through this step again.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.ASEAddAccount</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.ASEAddAccount</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter your Storage account name and Storage account key, and then click Add Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: Enter your Storage account name and Storage account key, and then click Add Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: You can add multiple storage accounts, and each account will be displayed on a tab.
trans-unit.target: You can add multiple storage accounts, and each account will be displayed on a tab.

trans-unit.source: Under Storage Type, click Blobs.
trans-unit.target: Under Storage Type, click Blobs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDI.ASEBlob</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDI.ASEBlob</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Container, click the name of the container that is associated with your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Under Container, click the name of the container that is associated with your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: When you create an HDInsight cluster, you must specify a container.
trans-unit.target: When you create an HDInsight cluster, you must specify a container.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the cluster creation process creates one for you.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the cluster creation process creates one for you.

trans-unit.source: Under Blob, click Upload.
trans-unit.target: Under Blob, click Upload.

trans-unit.source: Specify a file to upload, and then click Open.
trans-unit.target: Specify a file to upload, and then click Open.

trans-unit.source: Mount Azure Blob Storage as Local Drive
trans-unit.target: Mount Azure Blob Storage as Local Drive

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Mount Azure Blob Storage as Local Drive</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Mount Azure Blob Storage as Local Drive</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Services
trans-unit.target: Services

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Factory service is a fully managed service for composing data storage, data processing, and data movement services into streamlined, scalable, and reliable data production pipelines.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Factory service is a fully managed service for composing data storage, data processing, and data movement services into streamlined, scalable, and reliable data production pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory can be used to move data into Azure Blob storage, or to create data pipelines that directly use HDInsight features such as Hive and Pig.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory can be used to move data into Azure Blob storage, or to create data pipelines that directly use HDInsight features such as Hive and Pig.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Azure Data Factory documentation</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Apache Sqoop
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Apache Sqoop

trans-unit.source: Sqoop is a tool designed to transfer data between Hadoop and relational databases.
trans-unit.target: Sqoop is a tool designed to transfer data between Hadoop and relational databases.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to import data from a relational database management system (RDBMS), such as SQL Server, MySQL, or Oracle into the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS), transform the data in Hadoop with MapReduce or Hive, and then export the data back into an RDBMS.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to import data from a relational database management system (RDBMS), such as SQL Server, MySQL, or Oracle into the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS), transform the data in Hadoop with MapReduce or Hive, and then export the data back into an RDBMS.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Use Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: Development SDKs

trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage can also be accessed using an Azure SDK from the following programming languages:

trans-unit.target: .NET

trans-unit.target: Java

trans-unit.target: Node.js

trans-unit.target: PHP

trans-unit.target: Python

trans-unit.target: Ruby

trans-unit.target: For more information on installing the Azure SDKs, see <link><linkText>Azure downloads</linkText><title></title></link>
